page.title: 07Health in Johnstone
page.content: Corseford is a purpose_built residential school run by the Scottish Council for Spastics (a charity). It provides for 50 multiply_handicapped pupils aged 5_18 suffering from cerebal palsy and spina bifida. Being disabled makes everything harder. You have to think before doing everyday things. Just to be is difficult. They use many aids to make life easier; wheelchairs, walking frames, adapted typewriters and cutlery. Some pupils have no speech and use colour coded Bliss system by eye or finger pointing. Makaton sign language and finger spelling are also used. Computers are a link with the outside world and are a marvellous aid in many ways. 105 staff work in the school to help the pupils gain independence. People know very little about the handicapped.The school can do a lot.
